definition: a row/a line/to set in order/to arrange/to line up/to eliminate/to drain/to push open/platoon/raft/classifier for lines, rows etc
gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots

sentences.english: I authorize you to hit 'em a tremendous whack.
sentences.chinese: 我授權你們，向他們放一排狠毒的排槍。

sentences.english: The impression produced by this first discharge was freezing.
sentences.chinese: 這第一次排槍射擊給人的印象是夠寒心的。

sentences.english: It is as easy to dodge a volley as a single shot.
sentences.chinese: 躲避排槍與躲避單槍是一樣容易的。

sentences.english: The insurgents did not reply to this musketry, in order to spare their ammunition the fusillade broke against the barricade;
sentences.chinese: 起義者爲了節省彈藥，對這種排槍置之不理。

sentences.english: This smile was not ended when the report resounded.
sentences.chinese: 這微笑尚未結束，排槍就響了。

sentences.english: This was what Enjolras had caught in the intervals of the cannonade and the musketry.
sentences.chinese: 安灼拉在炮轟和排槍之間所聽到的就是這些聲音。
